snippet: Senators Charles E. Schumer and Kirsten E. Gillibrand have called for up to $1 billion in federal aid to repair and fortify parts of the coast from Montauk Point to Rockaway Beach hit by Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Senators Charles E Schumer and Kirsten E Gillibrand of New York call for up to $1 billion in federal aid to repair and fortify at least 120 miles of the state's coastline, from Montauk Point to Rockaway Beach, hit by Hurricane Sandy.
lead_paragraph: Senators Charles E. Schumer and Kirsten E. Gillibrand have called for up to $1 billion in federal aid to repair and fortify parts of the coast from Montauk Point to Rockaway Beach hit by Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: Schumer and Gillibrand Seek $1 Billion for N.Y. Coast Repair
headline.main: Senators Ask for $1 Billion in Aid for New York Coastline
headline.print_headline: Senators Ask For $1 Billion For Coastline Of New York
